results.title: Monument to the dream
results.creator_credit: Guggenheim Productions, L.T. Iglehart and Charles Guggenheim
results.brief_description: Interesting documentary on how St Louis’ magnificent new metal arch, the Gateway to the West, was built. Designed in a daring and innovative parabola by Eero Saarinen, the arch commemorates the Lewis and Clark Expedition. The arch’s construction posed new and unique challenges and this film shows the gradual mastery of the many difficulties.

results.title: Monty Python: Live at the Hollywood Bowl
results.brief_description: The Monty Python team perform some of their best sketches live to an American audience. John Cleese performs his silly walk, Eric Idle and Terry Jones feature in the infamous “Nudge, Nudge, Wink, Wink” skit, John Cleese appears in drag as an ice-cream vendor in Albatross” and the finale, “The Lumberjack song.

results.title: Monty Python and the holy grail [DVD]
results.creator_credit: National Film Trustee Corporation, Mark Forstater, Terry Gilliam and Terry Jones
results.brief_description: A comedy story, created and performed by the Monty Python team, that does have a slight resemblance to the Arthurian legend and the quest for the holy grail.

results.title: Monty Python's the meaning of life
results.creator_credit: HandMade Films, John Goldstone and Terry Jones
results.brief_description: If you’ve ever wanted to confront the great questions of existence head on, or to probe beneath the veneer of everyday life and discover the underlying truths that shape our Universe, then you should probably read “A history of western civilisation” by Bertrand Russell. If it’s a long way to your local library, however, or if you are afraid of contracting one of the rare dermatological diseases that can be picked up by handling too many serious books, then this hand crafted video cassette, in full colour and with full rewind facilities, could be the answer you’ve been looking for. Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Terry Gilliam, Eric Idle, Terry Jones and Michael Palin have distilled a lifetime’s experience into this cornucopia of erudition, enlightenment and something else beginning with ‘e’. Winner of the Special Jury Grand Prize, Cannes 1983 the video includes the short film “The crimson permanent insurance”.

results.title: Monty Python's life of Brian [DVD]
results.creator_credit: HandMade Films, John Goldstone and Terry Jones
results.brief_description: Iconic comedy from the Monty Python team, “The Life of Brian” ridicules Christianity, organised religion, politics, underground subversives and Jesus Christ. From birth, the unfortunate and guileless Brian is mistaken for the Son of God and dogged by his nearby presence as well as being pestered by his shrewish mother. The Monty Python crew each play numerous roles within the film, creating an anarchic madcap spoof of Biblical films and religious epics. With several musical interludes, including “Always look on the bright side of life” (sung at the crucifixion) the writers slay many sacred cows in the name of comedy. Blissfully sacrilegious and completely irreverent, “Life of Brian” was banned in several countries, but nevertheless garnered cult status and is regarded by many as the funniest of the Monty Python’s feature films. Also features Spike Milligan and Beatle George Harrison, whose company produced the film.

results.title: Monty
results.brief_description: Three friends, a rabbit (Tom), a duck (Doris) and a frog (Arthur) walk to school together every morning. Every morning and afternoon they wake up their snoozy, good-natured, easy-going alligator friend, Monty, to get a ride across the wide river in their way. They are somewhat ill-mannered and unappreciative of his help. One day Monty is not there, and finding they have no way to cross the river, they try 4 turtles, a catapult see-saw, balancing on Arthur. All attempts fail. “We need Monty” they cry, and Monty responds, carrying them on his back once more. Finally they appreciate, admire and thank him as bad manners are converted to good. Based on the book of the same name by James Stevenson. Suitable for children aged 4-8.

results.title: Montparnasse 19 = Modigliani of Montparnasse
results.brief_description:
Set in the bohemian quarter of Montparnasse (Paris) at the turn of the century, ‘Montparnasse 19’ follows the last days of the life of Modigliani. Thinking he is a failed painter, Modigliani has become an alcoholic. He survives thanks to the generosity of Rosalie, a restaurant owner, and his friend Zborovski. An art merchant, Morel, recognises the talent of the young painter, but prefers to wait patiently for his death in order to cash in.

Credits: Producer, Ralph Baum ; director, Jacques Becker ; writer, Henri Jeanson ; photography, Christian Matras ; music, Paul Misraki ; editor, Marguerite Renoir ; art direction, Jean d’Eaubonne.
Cast: Gerard Philipe, Anouk Aimee, Gerard Sety, Lino Ventura, Lili Palmer, Lea Padovani, Lila Kedrova, Marianne Oswald, Jean Lanier.

results.title: Montgomery Clift: the prince
results.creator_credit: Ciak Studio, Donatella Baglivo and Claudio Masenza
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood’s rebels”.
A documentary incorporating footage of Montgomery Clift’s most memorable films; interviews with family and with friends of Clift (including Jane Fonda); and rare archival material stretching back to his childhood. What develops is the story of an intense young boy who yearned for stardom, achieved notable success in such classic films as “From Here to Eternity” and “I Confess”, only to be ruined by alcohol addiction and his inability to face his own fears and homosexual desires. Montgomery Clift, as this video portrays him, may have not been a happy man but he never compromised his acting talents for Hollywood.

results.title: Monterey pop
results.creator_credit: John Phillips, Lou Adler and D.A. Pennebaker
results.brief_description: In June 1967, the Mamas and the Papas hosted a three day Pop Festival in Monterey, California. D.A. Pennebaker’s outstanding film is a record of extraordinary musicians and extraordinary insight into an era. This is the 60’s in celebration, exploding with new voices and optimistic energy. Performing artists include Janis Joplin, Otis Redding, Jimi Hendrix, Jefferson Airplane, Simon and Garfunkel, Scott McKenzie, Eric Burdon and the Animals, Canned Heat and The Who.
